intro: Tournefortia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas or near freshwater sources. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and horticultural applications.
